contentrichtext.text: {{Starbox short | | name=ζ Capricorni | epoch=[[J2000.0]] | constell=[[Capricornus]] | ra=21<sup>h</sup>26<sup>m</sup>40.0<sup>s</sup> | dec=−22°24′41″ | spectral=G4Ib Ba2 | appmag_v=+3.77 | dist_ly=398 ± 44 | dist_pc=122 ± 13 | names=34 Capricorni [[Harvard Revised catalogue|HR]] 8204, [[Henry Draper Catalogue|HD]] 204075, [[Bonner Durchmusterung|CD]]−22°15388, [[Fifth Fundamental Catalogue|FK5]] 806, [[Hipparcos catalogue|HIP]] 105881, [[Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory catalogue|SAO]] 190341, GC 30020, [[Star catalogue#ADS|ADS]] 14971, CCDM J21267-2225 }} '''Zeta Capricorni''', (ζ Cap, ζ Capricorni), is a [[Magnitude (astronomy)|fourth-magnitude]] [[star]] in the [[constellation]] [[Capricornus]]. ζ Capricorni is a [[binary star]], with the primary component '''ζ Capricorni A''' being a yellow [[stellar classification|G-type]] [[supergiant]] with an [[apparent magnitude]] of +3.77. It is considered one of the prototypical examples of a [[Barium star]], properties of which include overabundances of carbon molecules (such as C<sub>2</sub>) and [[s-process]] elements. Zeta Capricorni has an overabundance of the s-process element [[praseodymium]]. Its companion, '''ζ Capricorni B''' is a [[white dwarf]]. The ζ Capricorni binary system is approximately 398 [[light year]]s from [[Earth]]. ==Chinese Name== In [[Chinese language|Chinese]], {{lang|zh|十二國}} ({{lang|zh-Latn|Shíer Guó}}), meaning ''[[Girl (Chinese constellation)|Twelve States]]'', refers to an asterism which represents twelve ancient states in the [[Spring and Autumn Period]] and the [[Warring States Period]], consisting of ζ Capricorni, [[Phi Capricorni|φ Capricorni]], [[Iota Capricorni|ι Capricorni]], [[38 Capricorni]], [[35 Capricorni]], [[36 Capricorni]], [[Chi Capricorni|χ Capricorni]], [[Theta Capricorni|θ Capricorni]], [[30 Capricorni]], [[33 Capricorni]], [[19 Capricorni]], [[26 Capricorni]], [[27 Capricorni]], [[20 Capricorni]], [[Eta Capricorni|η Capricorni]] and [[21 Capricorni]].<ref>{{zh icon}} ''中國星座神話'', written by 陳久金. Published by 台灣書房出版有限公司, 2005, ISBN 978-986-7332-25-7.</ref> Consequently, ζ Capricorni itself represents the state of '''[[Yan (state)|Yan]]''' ({{lang|zh|燕}}).,<ref>[http://www.constellationsofwords.com/stars/DenebAlgedi.html Richard Hinckley Allen: Star Names — Their Lore and Meaning: Capricornus]</ref> together with [[Nu Ophiuchi|ν Ophiuchi]] in ''[[Heavenly Market enclosure|Left Wall of Heavenly Market Enclosure]]'' (asterism).<ref>{{zh icon}} [http://aeea.nmns.edu.tw/2006/0606/ap060623.html AEEA (Activities of Exhibition and Education in Astronomy) 天文教育資訊網 2006 年 6 月 23 日]</ref> ==References== * {{cite web | title=HD 204075 -- Star in double system | work=SIMBAD Astronomical Database | url=http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/sim-id.pl?protocol=html&Ident=zeta+capricorni&NbIdent=1&Radius=10&Radius.unit=arcmin&CooFrame=FK5&CooEpoch=2000&CooEqui=2000&output.max=all&o.catall=on&output.mesdisp=N&Bibyear1=1983&Bibyear2=2005&Frame1=FK5&Frame2=FK4&Frame3=G&Equi1=2000.0&Equi2=1950.0&Equi3=2000.0&Epoch1=2000.0&Epoch2=1950.0&Epoch3=2000.0 | accessdate=2007-04-01}} * [http://www.astro.uiuc.edu/~kaler/sow/zetacap.html Jim Kaler: Zeta Capricorni] {{reflist}} {{Stars of Capricornus}} [[Category:Bayer objects|Capricorni, Zeta]] [[Category:Capricornus (constellation)]] [[Category:Spectroscopic binaries]] [[Category:White dwarfs]] [[Category:G-type supergiants]] {{multi-star-stub}}
